definition: abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
to draw/picture/painting/CL:幅[fu2],張|张[zhang1]/classifier for paintings etc/variant of 劃|划[hua4]
the four arts (zither, Go, calligraphy, painting)/the accomplishments of a well-educated person

sentences.english: He founded an authentic transaction network for famous Chinese modern paintings and calligraphies in 2004.

sentences.english: A retired civil servant. He likes Chinese calligraphy, painting appreciation and the art of tea.
sentences.chinese: 退休公务员，喜爱欣赏书画及品茗等艺术。

sentences.english: Our country has a long history, culture, source of long, countless art since ancient times.
sentences.chinese: 我国历史悠久，文化源长，自古至今书画家不计其数。

sentences.english: In the history of Chinese art, Huang Shen, a highly successful calligraphers and painters.
sentences.chinese: 在中国美术史上，黄慎是一位卓有成就的书画家。

sentences.english: Organizational culture and art exchange and domestic famous calligraphy and painting exhibition auction.
sentences.chinese: 组织国内外文化艺术交流和名家书画作品展览拍卖。

sentences.english: So they were asked to draw their SOS families.
sentences.chinese: 所以他们被告知的是书画SOS的家庭。

sentences.english: Fine lines used in graphic arts to show shading.
sentences.chinese: 影线在书画刻印艺术中用于表示阴影部分的细线。

sentences.english: Chinese art of calligraphy and painting has its own peculiar ethical characteristics.
sentences.chinese: 中国书画艺术具有鲜明的民族特色。

sentences.english: In fact, since ancient times, the ingenious combination of poetry paintings of many people.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，自古以来，将诗书画结合巧妙的人大有人在。

sentences.english: Painting and poetry and can be printed, was awarded the "People's Artist"in the title.
sentences.chinese: 且诗书画印兼能，被授予“人民艺术家”的称号。

sentences.english: Poetry and painting, painting also came in last.
sentences.chinese: 琴棋书画，画也排在最后。

sentences.english: The untreated Xuan Paper is the main material for Chinese painting and calligraphy for it absorbs water easily.
sentences.chinese: 生宣具有吸水性能强的特点，是书画用纸的主要材料。

sentences.english: Her paintings and works have been exhibited in several exhibitions.
sentences.chinese: 书画作品多次参与展览。
